intro: Dombeya antsianakensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, and it produces fluffy, cotton-like seed capsules. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
